item.title: Amos add a quote by Joe Hill
item.description: "She breathed deeply of the scent of decaying fiction, disintegrating history, and forgotten verse, and she observed for the first time that a room full of books smelled like dessert: a sweet snack made of figs, vanilla, glue, and cleverness." -- Joe Hill

item.title: Amos add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "After the small woman had left, Ushikawa stared at the door for the longest time. She had shut the door behind her, but there was still a strong sense of her in the room. Maybe in exchange for leaving a trace of herself behind, she had taken away a part of Ushikawa's soul. He could feel that new void within his chest. Why did this happen? he wondered, finding it odd. And what could it possibly mean?" -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Amos add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Amos add a quote by Tim O'Brien
item.description: "Why do our politicians put warnings on cigarette packs and not on their own foreheads?" -- Tim O'Brien

item.title: Amos add a quote by Joe Hill
item.description: "The best way to get even with anyone is to put them in the rearview mirror on your way to something better." -- Joe Hill

item.title: Amos add a quote by Guillermo Del Toro, Chuck Hogan
item.description: "...the reality of the days washed away the possibilities of the past, and time moved on." -- Guillermo Del Toro, Chuck Hogan

item.title: Amos add a quote by Steven King
item.description: "Every moral precept is an delusion. Even the stars are a mirage. The truth is darkness, and the only thing that matters is making a statement before one enters it. Cutting the skin of the world and leaving a scar. That's all history is, after all: scar tissue." -- Steven King
